title: Issues with numpy-like broadcasting
body_html:
The code (attached below) throws an error when run
x=torch.FloatTensor(5,1,4,1)
y=torch.FloatTensor( 3,1,1)
(x+y).size()

RuntimeError: inconsistent tensor size at /py/conda-bld/pytorch_1490981920203/work/torch/lib/TH/generic/THTensorMath.c:827

Pytorch Version: 0.1.12

This is an example that took from here: http://pytorch.org/docs/master/notes/broadcasting.html
Any idea how to get this working?
body_text:
The code (attached below) throws an error when run
x=torch.FloatTensor(5,1,4,1)
y=torch.FloatTensor(  3,1,1)
(x+y).size()

RuntimeError: inconsistent tensor size at /py/conda-bld/pytorch_1490981920203/work/torch/lib/TH/generic/THTensorMath.c:827

Pytorch Version: 0.1.12
This is an example that took from here: http://pytorch.org/docs/master/notes/broadcasting.html
Any idea how to get this working?
body:
The code (attached below) throws an error when run
`x=torch.FloatTensor(5,1,4,1)`
`y=torch.FloatTensor(  3,1,1)`
`(x+y).size()`

> RuntimeError: inconsistent tensor size at /py/conda-bld/pytorch_1490981920203/work/torch/lib/TH/generic/THTensorMath.c:827

Pytorch Version: 0.1.12

This is an example that took from here: http://pytorch.org/docs/master/notes/broadcasting.html
Any idea how to get this working?
